intro: Geonoma demarastei, commonly known as the Brazilian nettle or *Geonoma demarastei*, is a species of fern belonging to the family Davalliaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features a rosette of lance-shaped, serrated leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its reproductive structures, called sorus, are located on the underside of the fronds and produce spores for propagation. Geonoma demarastei plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to the biodiversity of the understory vegetation.
